articles.description: All the reaction after Manchester City and Arsenal are knocked out of the Champions League quarter-finals.
articles.title: Champions League reaction after Man City and Arsenal knocked out

articles.description: Lewis Hamilton says he will join his old rival Fernando Alonso in racing in Formula 1 'well into my 40s'.
articles.title: Formula 1: Lewis Hamilton says he plans to race 'well into' his 40s

articles.description: FA Cup replays will be scrapped from the first round onwards in the 2024-25 competition.
articles.title: FA Cup replays scrapped from first round onwards

articles.description: Philadelphia 76ers and Chicago Bulls reach the NBA play-offs with victories over Miami Heat and Atlanta Hawks respectively.
articles.title: NBA: Philadelphia 76ers edge past Miami Heat to reach play-offs

articles.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan will play Jackson Page in the first round of World Championship as he bids for a record eighth title in the modern era.
articles.title: World Snooker Championship draw: Ronnie O'Sullivan to face Jackson Page in first round

articles.description: Former Australia captain Meg Lanning says a struggle with weight loss and insomnia led to her international retirement.
articles.title: Weight loss 'spiral' led to Lanning's retirement

articles.description: Manchester City's dreams of winning a second successive Treble were left in tatters by Real Madrid, writes Phil McNulty.
articles.title: 'Man City's Treble dreams left in tatters by Real'

articles.description: Rhona Lloyd will win her 50th Scotland cap as fellow winger Francesca McGhie returns to the starting XV against Italy in the Women's Six Nations.
articles.title: Scotland make four changes for trip to Italy

articles.description: Mikel Arteta says he must show his Arsenal side "support and love" after they were knocked out in the Champions League.
articles.title: Arsenal need 'support and love' after exit - Arteta

articles.description: Ballon d'Or winner Aitana Bonmati says things "have not changed" for female players in Spain despite winning the 2023 Women's World Cup.
articles.title: Liga F not changed after World Cup win - Bonmati
